content.description: Easy plates lead to underclings and the burly business. Then super-cool features to anchor.
The right-most 2 routes share a start and 1 bolt, then Stop The Steel branches right. It is the easiest line at the crag, and one of the few single digit routes I've put up.
content.location: Right-most route at crag. Shares start and 1st bolt with Reverb.

content.description: Very fun and not a give-away. Cool holds and movement. Shares start and 1 bolt with Stop The Steel. 4 bolts to anchor. First line to go up at crag.
content.location: 2nd route from right side. Shares first bolt with Stop the Steel (which is the left-most route).

content.description: Good crux at bottom leads to cool roof. Nice features lead to another crux up top.
content.location: Starts just left of the big pine.

content.description: Starts with Total Recall but quickly branches left to its own first bolt. Then a stiff bulge, followed by cool holds. Needs two more bolts.Putting info here so you won't wonder what's going on if you spy what looks like stray anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts and Climbtech hooks. MISSING FIRST TWO BOLTS. Was rained out while drilling.
content.location: Left of Total Recall. Starts up same pretty/easy plates.

content.description: Short route with cool crux and features. Touch harder than Reverb. 1.5 star.
content.location: Just right of the large pine.

content.description: Interesting features between Reverb and Rebound caused us to squeeze this line in. Good crux at 20 foot level.Might want to stick-clip first bolt.

An overhanging 5.10 is rare on Lemmon. I would give 3 stars if it were longer. Great features and pretty steady at the grade. Thirty feet left of the big pine, look up to see a small dihedral going up, then curving left near the top of the crag. The route follows the dihedral, then moves right where the dihedral curves left. Overhangs 4-5 feet. Starts just right of Double Trouble.
content.location: On the far left side of the crag there is a big roof. Right of that, 2 routes go up nice plates starting quite close together. Double Feature is the right-hand of the 2 routes.The left-hand of the 2 routes (Double Trouble) has a cabledraw.

content.description: Cool features and a stiff crux. Left side. Easily identified by locating the cabledraw just above the little midway roof.
content.location: Just right of the big roof at the left end of the crag. Cabledraw marks it.

content.description: Echo is a good little crag in Upper Sabino canyon not far from Summerhaven. You park at Marshall Gulch to get there. The crag faces ENE so you get shade around noon, and it lasts the rest of the day. Plus there is a big pine that provides shade on the middle routes even in the morning depending on time of day/year.This crag is a nice hang and has spectacular views. You can see Raycray to the NE. You can see Ireland across the canyon due east. You can see the Spectrum crags spread out to the SE. You are high up on the west side of the canyon and therefore will catch breezes. You are not far from The Steep and Delta. And it only takes 15 minutes from the parking to get to the crag ! One problem: parking on weekends. Marshall Gulch is a popular place these days, and parking is limited... come early on weekends.The right-side routes are easier and shorter... only about 30 feet. The left-side routes are longer and mostly harder. The crag offers lots of underclings, side-pulls, and other cool features that add a lot of fun.All of the routes have ClimbTech hooks and all have SS bolts at least 3.75 inches in length.
